Who Am I?

I'm Lawrence Borst, a recent graduate from The University of Warwick. I hope to share my enthusiasm for many of the things I came to love during my studies, such as physics, computer science, music and mathematics.

Latest Post:

Finding chords in microtonal music

20 Nov 2020

I see microtonal music as an often dissonant art. This perception owes itself in part to its strangeness, but also to scientific principles that make many types of microtonal music unattractive. For example, imagine a pitch. Play it in your head, and then layer it with a second pitch just slightly above the first. What youâ€™re hearing is a dissonant interval, and we shall go over the reason why that may be.
